alert.note: Alert for Cascades in Lane County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 2:18PM PST until February 08 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 4500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Blowing snow possible. * WHERE...Cascades in Lane County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest snow amounts are expected in the Three Sisters area, while Willamette Pass likely to receive closer to 5 inches. Below 4500 feet, expect up to 3 inches snow accumulation.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
